38533162.review:
If you're a fan of the voice work of Justin Roiland of Rick and Morty fame, or the kind of humour found in William Pugh's former games, Dr Langeskov or the The Stanley Parable, then you'll instantly feel right at home with Accounting, a short, but very funny comedy VR experience about a VR accountancy experiment gone wrong.

I have started watching Rick and Morty quite recently, and I really like the stuttering, almost adlib style Justin brings to his voice work, and that is very evident here, with one of his characters in particular sounding very similar to Morty. It's also just as blue as your average episode of R&M with plenty of F Bombs throughout.

The game says it requires the HTC Vive but it worked fine on the Oculus Rift, however the whole game was designed for Room Scale VR, and for the most part you'll be facing away from the sensors which did for me, cause the occasional issue with occlusion, but nothing that ruined the experience. There is no teleportation so you will need an area of around 2m x 1.5m to be able to reach the corners of the room, but again, there aren't really any situations where this is required.

The game itself is a linear experience where you move between a series of VR worlds and have to try and find your way to the next one, which is usually only a matter of doing one simple puzzle, but the fun of each zone for me was to hang around and listen to all the dialog. You could probably finish the game in 5 minutes if you are rushing through, but there is 20-30 minutes of content there if you take your time and listen to everything.

Overall this is one of the better free VR experiences i've tried and though there isn't really any reason to play it a 2nd time, it put a smile on my face for 25 minutes, which is good enough for me.

7.5/10

35705158.review:
ACHTUNG: Empfehlung mit Einschränkung.

Ich konnte das Spiel leider nicht beenden, da mir leider nicht genug Platz zum Spielen zur Verfügung stand. Das Spiel ist wirklich nur für Setups mit einem größeren Spielbereich geeignet, da man immer mal wieder aufgefordert wird, einen Gegenstand aufzunehmen, der ein Stück weit entfernt liegt / hängt (Telefone). Bei mir war das in der zweiten Welt schlichtweg nicht mehr möglich, da ich durch meine (reale) Wand hätte hindurch greifen müssen. 
Hier wäre vlt ein optionaler Bewegungsmodus nicht verkehrt (Teleport o.ä.). Klar ist das nicht so immersiv wie wenn man sich wirklich durch den virtuellen Raum bewegt, allerdings ist die Immersion erst recht futsch wenn ich den Controller gegen die Wand drücke und hoffe dass meine ingame Hand durch fehlerhaftes Tracking doch noch auf das verflixte Telefon "glitcht".

Ein Tipp an Alle die ein ähnliches Problem haben: Stellt euch möglichst weit entfernt von dem Gegenstand, mit dem ihr interagieren sollt, auf, und setzt die Ansicht per Steam VR Menü zurück. In der ersten Welt ("Tree-World") konnte ich dadurch gerade so an alle Gegenstände gelangen.

Ansonsten bleibt nur zu sagen, dass Freunde des Rick und Morty Humors hier auf ihre Kosten kommen. Ich musste direkt lachen als ich in der ersten Welt gelandet bin, und da das Spiel kostenlos ist hat sich das allein schon für mich gelohnt.

34333201.review:
I'm sure this game is as funny as the other reviews claim it to be, but unfortunately the developers didn't put much consideration into the play space.  Unless you're play area is significantly larger than the minimum spec, you probably won't be able to play the game.

I have a play area that just meets the minimum requirements for room scale (2m x 1.5m, as specified by Steam).  The developers, however, didn't build the game to the same specs, and place items required to advance the game outside of the minum play area.  Just a little bit outside the area, mind you, but when that little bit corresponds to a wall or desk, it makes playing the game impossible.  The worst part is that this could have easily been fixed, either by just placing the props a few feet closer, or implementing some teleportation mechanic. 

I get that the game is free, but when its rendered unplayable by failing to meet its own specifications, and the fix is something so trivial, I honestly don't see how I can recommend it.

I've watched several different friends play it now, and I refuse to give them any help, because watching them struggle to figure out what the heck is going on is the most entertaining thing that happens in my living room. 

And honestly, even if you figure everything out quickly and can complete the whole experience in 15 (or so) minutes, it's worth it to stand around doing nothing for a while, just to hear the ingenious banter.

31169844.review:
If you're a Rick & Morty Fanboy who doesn't enjoy constructive criticism, feel free to ignore this review. Skip to the end where I talk about TL;DR.

1) If you are a(n adult) Rick and Morty Fan: Sure, go ahead, download this and enjoy it.

My roommate and I had the same reaction to this; why do devs keep putting the voice actors from Rick & Morty into every VR title out there? But if you are a fan, grab it, play the 5-10 minutes, and enjoy the foul-mouthed humor.

2) Adults Only. This title should come with a Violence, Strong Language, and Sexual warning label.

I didn't mind, but it was a shock to hear (and do) some of the stuff in this experience when I wasn't expecting it. I definitely would not allow a child under 12 to play this one.

3) Don't play this if anyone in your life has ever committed suicide.

This was cleanly made, but ultimately an unsatisfying experience. The game swears at you (repeatedly), makes you cut open a dude, sexually stimulate a xylophone, and commit suicide three times. While some folks might find that funny, I didn't. It was foul language without purpose, violence and gore for no good reason, and the whole suicide thing that kept playing out was really, really unpleasant.

TL;DR: If you like Rick & Morty, and don't have a problem with gratuitous sex, violence, foul language, and committing suicide then you might like this experience.

I mainly only recommend this because it is free. The dry sense of humor and crudeness was unexpected, which made this a pretty surreal VR experience. Each scenario thrown at you is really funny and the voice acting was very well done.

I had some technical issues with this though, where the visuals would become garbled toward the end of the experience. I also experienced a few crashes and had to start over. When you do start over, you can essentially "speed run" through everything you've seen before to catch up to what you haven't seen yet. The overall experience is relatively short, which is why I am glad I didn't have to pay for this. If it was a dollar or two, it might be worth it if there weren't any bugs.

This is definitely not for kids though, unless you want to teach them some very "colorful" language. Overall, I would definitely try this out since it's free and you have nothing to lose. I can't wait to see my friends reactions to this. I just hope they work out all of the bugs soon, because it seems to glitch 100% of the time at specific points.

It's not a game, it's an experience - of being a character inside a weird and twisted story-line that truly reflects the meta-mastery of the "Rick & Morty" team.  It is also a peek into the incredible future VR holds in store: I clearly foresee a time not too far away when the brightest story-telling talents flee the dysfunctional 2-D Hollywood industry to create independent-studio story 'experiences' for VR viewers that will blow away the best of the high-buck blockbusters.  No joke, no hype.  I would rather pay $10 for this than anything I've seen at a theater in years.  "Accounting" is not for everybody, but it points the way to a truly squanchy future for us all.

28993623.review:
Though this doesn't seem to be specifically tied to Rick and Morty, the iconic humor is unmistakable and everpresent in this short VR trip, with all the pros and cons implied.
Rick and Morty's humor is awkward, abrasive, mildly insulting, and generally uncomfortable, and though it is apparently popular, for those with whom it is not, it is a complete turn off.

Pros: Being FREE, offering no monetary risk to the player, gives this game plenty of leeway. Whether you like the humor or not, it is still an excellent and mildly creative look into how room scale can be used.

Cons: If you don't like what you see in the 2 - 3 minutes of the first scene, it's not going to get any better further in. You have 7 total scenes for maybe 15-30 minutes of gameplay (or as little as 5 if you really rush through everything) So it's up to you to decide if it's worth continuing to wade through more of the same.

Bug Warning: I haven't experienced this myself, but I have a 2mx2m play area, with the ability to extend outside by a bit on most sides. Those with more limited space may find some objects are outside the reach of their usable room. The devs already know about this issue and have said they will be working on the issue.

Also, this really has nothing to do with accounting, except possibly to encapsulate the general feeling of having everyone rudely badgering you at the same time with useless instructions to do what they think you should be doing.

This game... err... challenge... uhh... experience, was interesting...

First off, I would rate the game mature for language and themes. Definitely wouldn't want my kids playing this (don't be fooled by the cute, cartoony imagery on the icon). That being said, the game has moments where you think to yourself, "this might actually be fun". I would categorize this title as a puzzle game hiding behind a dirty, hybrid facade of Family Guy and South Park. It's entertaining for it's short lifespan and definitely worth the admission price (free, just in case they decide to start charging for it). 

Technically, the game was alright. Most of the scenes were fluid with very few bugs and a decent level of interactivity. I believe they do an adequate job of representing the capabilities of VR.

Overall, I would give this title a 5/10, which isn't bad considering what it is; a 30 minute distraction from reality. Play it once: snicker, tremble, yawn, and then throw it away.

28192483.review:
You start off in an accounting office barraged by comments from a couple guys through the intercom who talk you through the process of aquiring a pair of VR goggles hidden in the office and putting them on which transport you to various VR worlds.  The worlds are all interesting and original.  You need to perform a task in each world, all done in fun ways, to move on to the next one.  Your end goal is to get back to "reality" in the accounting office.

It's a very fun game of mis-adventure and an inception-esque VR experience.  I find that Its over the top ridiculousness is an exciting alternative to many VR games on the market today.


If you've ever seen the animated series 'Rick and Morty' then this is the same sort of feel.  A few of the characters are actually voiced by the same guy who does Morty.

26487346.review:
游戏中，你将化身会计事务所的工作人员，通过VR眼镜，进行一系列的穿越，并且犯下案件，最终走上审判法庭。
　　整体谜题的设置都属于脑洞大开型，例如破开肚子找道具、毒死自己离开梦境、杀死说出不利证词的证人......十分有意思。不过仔细解读，就会发现其中隐隐藏着逻辑线，只要按照正常的逻辑思维走，再加以夸张化，做一些你平时想做却不敢或者不能做的事情就能解开。
　　作为一款解谜游戏，该游戏没有在谜题部分多为难玩家，把难度控制在合理范围内，让多数谜题的设置都能被玩家轻易破解。甚至有时候，就直接把提示与操作方法标识在旁边，玩家只需要按照暗示进行操作即可。
　　按理说，这种没有多少难度的设定，多少会令人觉得很没意思，可该游戏却很好地避免了这种情况。一是因为玩家每解开一个迷，都会惊奇于制作者脑洞之大;二是游戏在画面与音效部分做出了很好的弥补，让玩家将注意力分散;三是游戏整体流程较短，却有接二连三惊喜，而玩家的惊艳感还未消化殆尽，游戏就接近尾声了，给人一种浅尝即止却意犹未尽的感觉，以致于总觉得不够满足，而想要体验更多。
　　游戏画面质量极高，拟人化的制作方式非常讨喜，且表情与着装的细节都非常清晰、生动，玩家可以用手将它们拿在眼前，好好地观赏一番。
　　我们很少会在游戏当中听到骂人脏话，尤其在中国境内，对游戏管控极严的情况下，这些词汇要么被和谐，要么根本就是被禁止掉。
　　而在该游戏中，却包含有大量的骂人词汇，特别是第二个场景当中，一上来就对出现在它地盘中的玩家破口大骂，对此种带入等同黄赌毒元素，以获取爆点的做法，我们持有否定态度。
　　不过撇开对这些词汇的纠结，我们也能看到其中所包含的美式幽默，通过一连串无间隔的语言，加上一些带高高低低情绪起伏的语气，带动了整体游戏的节奏，让玩家玩起来轻松又惬意，不会单纯地停留解谜与解不开谜的尴尬境况中。
　　甚至很多人说，在这一段会让人产生一些莫名的兴奋、强烈的代入感，非常惊艳，不过这就是比较个人的感受了。当然，玩这个游戏的前提是，玩家必须有一点点的英文基础，才能够听得懂。
　　《叙述》(Accounting)的画面十分精致，玩法另类有趣，虽然谜题难度设置得不高，但整体游戏的可玩性极高，不过游戏主题确实比较成人向，不适合孩子玩。
　　整体游戏流程大约在30分钟左右，不算长也不算特别短，却能留给玩家浓浓的意犹未尽之感，玩完了还想推荐给别人。Steam商店中，可以免费下载到该游戏，推荐给所有适龄玩家，尝鲜体验一番。

更多游戏评测：http://newgame.83830.com/

I didn't enjoy this game.

Maybe I'm too used to VR, but I wouldn't recomend this to a new VR user either.

It expected the game to be funny, but it rather annoyed me. There was no "Oh that is funny" moment. I was constantly bombarded with repetition and violence, with loud and mixed sentences and words.
It was a bit like being part of a tv show where the characters are annoying, but you cannot reply or talk back.

One might argue that a part of the point of the game is to annoy the user, playing with the different VR levels/glasses, where you remove them in the end to "go back" away from the annoyance; finally removing your real headset after you have finished the (annoying) game.

I personally don't find being annoyed to be enjoyable. Specially when I find myself not being able to defend or protect myself from the annoyance at any time.

26155070.review: Very very good and suprising dialogue :D

26155050.review:
Do you know these types of friends that just talk and talk and talk and at some point you just think "Kevin, can you just STFU already?". This game is basically a Kevin simulator.
I swear if this wasn't a game, I'd think it's a bootcamp where the superiors scream at you in an attempt to break you to make you a better soldier while you do sit-ups.

If you like Family Guy with the jokes consisting of repeating the same sentence over and over and over until you don't find it funny anymore, this game is for you.

At first it's pretty funny and the overall story is unique, but man, the voice acting is making me angry. I don't get why it's necessary to just repeat the same stuff until your ears bleed. When a joke is funny, why tell me 50 times in a row? The 10th time it isn't funny anymore, let alone the other 40 times coming.

Here's a monologue which could be in the game. [b]This one is made up by me, but it's an example how virtually every monologue in the game is[/b]. Imagine that in the high pitched voice of Morty.

"Hello, are you there? Hello? Are you there? I can hear you. You are there, are you? Please say anything if you are... there? Anything. Please. Can you please say anything? Please, uhm, anything. You are there, right? Hello? I really need to talk to someone. If you don't say anything, f*** off. But better talk to me. I gonna kill myself if you don't talk. Hello? Hello? Hello? Are you there? Listen, uhm, please listen to me. Please. Say anything you like. I don't even listen. Just say something. Hello?"

Annoyed already by my mockup? Well, then better don't play the game.

Other than that, the game is great. Unfortunately, most of the stuff you do is listen.

I wish there was a button so I could rate it "I don't give a f***, it's free, try yourself". Until then I rate it a no, which is close.

I have two questions: What the BLEEP were the devs smoking, and where can I get some? In all seriousness, this is by some margin (and then some) one of the most creative, witty and funny VR title I've encountered so far. Accounting's the name. What do you expect from that name? Some sort of job simulator. What do you get? A crazy Alice-in-Wonderland-esque ride. But of the American McGee kind. Ok, it's not that scary at all. More ... insane.

Basically it's yet one another "get out of this room" sim. But ... in a very, very crazy and waaaay over the top funny way. Also awesome voice acting and well made graphics. And while I really wish I had hands instead of mouse cursors, hey, it fits into the whole craziness of the rest of the game.

Hope they keep creating more. I'd gladly throw money their way for more of the same!

26139355.review:
I love Rick & Morty and this pretty much brings all of that bizarre humor into the VR world.  I had quite a few really good laughs watching/participating in this.  I expected it to be more of a passive movie type experience but you actually have to do stuff to progress through it.    Don't worry though, I figured it out so you should have no problem.

Stuff I liked:
[list]
   [*] Rick and morty voices and humor
   [*] It also had a slight "Stanley Parable" feel to it at times
   [*] It's Free! Don't wait to download it and try it, DO IT! DO IT NOW!
[/list]

Things I didn't like:
[list]
   [*] A little more variety in the dialog and this would be great. It's fun to watch, but after you do one time through you probably won't need to run it again.
   [*] Some parts are obvious what to do, other parts are not so obvious.  I figured it all out anyway, but it could be better.
   [*] There's just not enough of it.   I want more... I want like a whole series of this type of stuff where you have to figure your way through the virtual worlds.  
[/list]

So yeah, I don't have much bad to say about it, and it's worth the download and time to run it .... Definitely check it out.

26125702.review:
(Longer review coming later)

I haven't watched Rick & Morty, but this thing had me laughing or grinning all the way through.

I think its length is perfect because a longer playtime may wear out this type of humour.

You are basically thrown from scenario to absurd scenario, with escalating chaos, surrounded by fools and jerks, who yell the most inane, hilarious stuff at you. Voice acting is great all around.

It runs great, and looks great, using a cartoony style that's effective without being demanding.

Interactions are simple and consist of looking around, picking up stuff and putting them places. There's no need to teleport or manage anything.

This would make for a great "my first VR" experience, especially because it's likely to traumatise your friends.

26125485.review:
I love Rick and Morty, first for being funny, second for being smart, truly deep and deriving true meaning underneath all the jokes. I also enjoyed Stanley Parable for being engaging and a truly interesting concept. Accounting is funny sometimes, but most of the gags fell flat for me. Listening through entire dialogs doesn't pay off. "This is my place, this is my tree place, get out of my place, this is my place. H-Hey, this is my tree. Get out of here, this is mine." The story is loose and when it's all over there's not much to reflect on.

I was hoping for more from the creator of 2 of the most clever and funny animated series ever made and the Designer of Stanley Parable. Hopefully they rerelease Accounting, give it a price and make it a 1-3 hour game with more polish. Please.

26119890.review:
This was absolutely as bonkers as I hoped it would be!
Thank you for making this wonderful piece of weird humour, I am absolutely looking forward to future work of you guys :)
The way you made use of roomscale felt just right and everyone I gave it to immediately got hold of the controls.
I think you did important pioneer work for VR in terms of humour, usability and establishing ridiculous characters that still are believable and without creating a creep factor. Especially the way the characters look at the player and respond to its actions worked really well, there was no feeling of being talked at by interactive dolls that were possessed by something, a problem other VR games definetely have.

10/10 if you are into wonderfully weird humour, love burning down forests and tend to have a talkative attitude towards whiteboards.

I think depending on how long you spend listening for every line of script and searching for little extra touches, it can probably take up to an hour, and if you're really impatient it'll take 10 to 15 minutes (or 5 minutes if you played through once and deliberately "speed-run" it).

I feel like I haven't quite discovered all the Easter egg aspects of this yet, but the meat of the experience is already plenty entertainment.

一种惊艳，目前来讲这算是一场奇妙的VR中的VR之旅。

玩了之后会有莫名的兴奋，已经强烈的代入感。

当然，前提还是能够听懂两句英语。即使不懂英文，游戏的交互简单，也能让你有不错的体验。

————————————————————————

这是我玩过的第一款充斥着垃圾话，脏话的 VR 游戏。想想还挺带感，FOCK U，Dev.

树洞里的垃圾精灵，一见面就是各种喷，抛开这个碧池单看环境，你会以为自己在玩《看火人》

小小的天地里，小小的风景也让人沉醉。

第二个场景的胖子，真的是个温柔的胖子，别问为什么，它看起来像个好胖子。

最后，毒死自己离开这个迷幻的世界，当然等待你的将会是一场审判。

总体来讲，这款免费的游戏在剧情和游戏设计上有着明显的特色。

这就是我打开Steam看到一款刚出的免费游戏尽然有数百人同时在玩的原因吧。

这款游戏里含有太多的美式幽默，玩起来轻松惬意，还有一点小害怕。

开体验店的老板你们可以装起来给大学生玩了，哈哈

——————————————————————————————

最后，有什么建议和想法请留言告知哦。我们下一个酷炫的 VR 游戏见！

40350412.review:
Accounting muss man mal gesehen haben. (getestet mit der HTC Vive)
Dieses kleine "Spiel" gehört einfach in jede Sammlung. 
Wir erleben den täglichen Wahnsinn eines Buchhalters in einer wirklich kranken, verrückten Welt.
Der Humor erinnert an Rick and Morty, die Grafik ist gelungen, die Dialoge mehr als grandios (nur englisch) und die Steuerung funktioniert auch soweit ganz gut, Roomscale wird genutzt.
Das Spiel lief sehr gut mit einer GTX 970, keinerlei Abbrüche oder Trackingprobleme. Lediglich 1x gab es ein Problem bei der Kolisionsabfrage, aber war nur ein wenig hakelig, funktionierte trotzdem.
Da es mir etwas schwer fällt, diese Erfahrung in Worte zu fassen, probiert es einfach aus, es ist gratis. 
Ich kann jedem nur empfehlen, einen Blick auf diesen kleinen Geniestreich zu werfen.

Gruß Ziffi
Ziffi´s Spieletipps als Kurator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

39974465.review:
Super enjoyable, although not a long run-through, it makes up for gameplay with nonsense. 
If you like Rick and Morty, do yourself a favor and download this free game (if you have the Vive). 

One aspect I loved was getting yelled at by one character while on the phone trying understand wtf was happening from two others. 

Great job, DEV team. Hopefully one day characters and situations like these will be implemented in games that last longer than 15 min. 
On that note, I would totally pay for a game like this, especially if it had multiplayer/puzzle solving aspects. 

9999/10 - Character Design
10/10 - VR Game idea

Gameplay/Environment Interactions could be a bit more "interactive".

Best part of the game was being cursed out by some animated NPC. 
Would love to play something like this if DEVs implemented a locomotion engine, and more interactive scene. 

Thanks for the great fun though - this DEV group is probably going to break the internet.

39613080.review:
While the game seems charming at first, it quickly becomes apparant that its horribly unfunny.
As soon as i saw who made this, i had high hopes from the creators of rick and morty. But of course instead of being insightful, meta, or showing restraint. They instead opted for the garbage cut away gags that were not funny in the show to begin with. They either messed up hard, or the creators cant make anything other than character driven jokes.
I understand that they need to drag out jokes for people that stick around, but portal does it 100x's better. You have these forgettable nameless characters that just never stop talking and stuttering, instead of writing witty dialouge they just keep repeating lines and stuttering. Its very clear they ad-libbed one take for most of these scenes. It desperatly wants you to continue the game, while also trying to entertain you with bottom of the barrel humor. If you spend roughly 2 minutes in each section, youd have the best experience. The problem is the game is less than 10 minutes long, and a torturing 1 hour long if you are crazy enough to withstand the constant gibberish.

Just look up a video. Its honestly not worth putting on the headset to just stand there, occasionally grabbing things
